channel.title: Asset Options on Entota Hugo POC
channel.description: Recent content in Asset Options on Entota Hugo POC

item.title: Share URLs for Assets
item.description: You can collaborate with other users by sharing the URL for an asset. To copy the asset’s direct link to share: Search for the asset. In the asset’s Preview panel, click the Copy direct link to clipboard () icon. This copies the link to your clipboard. Next, you can paste the link to share, for example in an email. To share the URL for an asset from the asset’s details page:

item.title: View Change History for Assets
item.description: You can view changes to an asset including the name of the person who changed the asset along with the date and time of the change. You can view the details for the change to see: Location – The name of field that changed Previous – The contents of the field before it was changed New – The new contents of the field To view the change history for an asset:

item.title: Comment on an Asset
item.description: You can comment on assets. Commenting, unless you are commenting about a Contest to an asset, does not change the status of the asset. You can include URL links in your comments. To comment on an asset: Search for and open the asset. Enter the comment in the Add a New Comment field in the comments panel. Click the plus () icon. NOTE: To edit or delete your comment after it has been added, you can click the pencil or X icon next to the comment.

item.title: Add Supporting Documentation to Assets
item.description: You can attach documentation that relates to an asset. To add supporting documentation to an asset: Search for and open the asset. Click the Supporting Documentation tab. Add the title for the documentation in the ADD TITLE field. Paste the URL to the documentation in the PASTE URL field. NOTE: Starting with DSP 7.0.2, users can easily copy DSP page URLs, filtered or with binding criteria, to use as documentation for an asset in Entota.

item.title: Enforcement Profiles
item.description: Enforcement Profiles document information about the purpose, the implementation, and the technology behind rule enforcement. With this information, business and technical users can easily understand how rules are enforced and the impact rules have on the business. The profiles accommodate different types of rules: rules that are automatically enforced via enforcement technology (for example, the DSPÂ®), rules that are enforced via manual tasks, and rules that are not enforced but require documentation.
